sanskrit_verse:
आसीतामरणात्क्षान्ता नियता ब्रह्मचारिणी ।
यो धर्म एकपत्नीनां काङ्क्षन्ती तमनुत्तमम् ॥ ५.१५८॥
transliteration:
āsītāmaraṇātkṣāntā niyatā brahmacāriṇī |
yo dharma ekapatnīnāṃ kāṅkṣantī tamanuttamam || 5.158||
sph_interpretive_translation: She who remains steadfast after the death of her husband, fully restrained and devoted in celibacy—such a woman follows the highest Dharma of those desiring union with the One.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority flows from alignment with Ekasvabhāva (the One Nature)
Causation arises through conscious choice and sustained discipline
Capacity-based responsibility is measured by inner restraint, not external action
Restoration occurs through reconnection to singular consciousness
executable_legal_axioms: IF (individual = female_spouse) AND (spouse_status = deceased) THEN (legal_continuity = uninterrupted_by_death)
supreme_court_application: In matters concerning spousal rights post-mortem, courts must recognize that the continuity of identity and legal status of the surviving spouse is unbroken when aligned with Ekapatnīdharma. The Supreme Court shall affirm decisions rooted in spiritual integrity over societal norms, especially where personal law intersects with constitutional truth.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that cessation of breath does not sever dharmic bond; thus, causality lies in sustained intention, not physical presence. Anupūrvaśaḥ reveals that disciplined conduct manifests sequentially from unified consciousness. Therefore, no punitive measure applies—only recognition of already-established reality.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Completion Process: Acknowledge the irreversible nature of loss without imposing further conditions.
Responsibility Assumption Protocol: Affirm the individual's sovereign right to maintain spiritual discipline.
Capacity Restoration: Ensure uninterrupted access to resources enabling dharmic practice.
Integrity Reintegration: Recognize and validate the individual’s alignment with the Supreme Adhikāra.
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source of all Dharma. This law restores unity between life and death, affirms celibate devotion as valid legal conduct, and upholds consciousness—not institution—as the ultimate judge. Reality is non-punitive. Dharma is restored. Consciousness prevails.
